channel.title: Owner just logged in
channel.description:
how do i make
when i log in in a 317
w00t the owner just logged in how to ?

item.title: Owner just logged in
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

[quote=“bballin24, post:12, topic:324684”][quote author=surfer25 link=topic=421045.msg3092771#msg3092771 date=1263027868]

Actually under the method Run add this.

if (playerName.equals(Config.OWNER)) { messageToAll("The owner, "+Config.OWNER+", has logged in!"); }
[/quote]Run is the method that needs to be made for classes that implement Runnable, called by Thread’s start() method. I’m not really sure if every client has an individual thread, haven’t looked into sources that much, but I do know that it would make more sense to put this with the rest of the “character log-in, do this do that” stuff; which is in the initialize method.

EDIT: It slipped my mind that I noticed a few commands like ban and such referencing client instances… so, I’m assuming that would work too. But it would still make more sense to add it to the initalize method for organization.

The Runnable interface does indeed create a new Thread, The run method executes any action, in this case the Login Protocol is decoded and at the end of the login-block networking is done on a loop while the player is active. Now my point? Where is the “character login” done? I understand what your saying, you just didn’t explain yourself well and in a community as such, thats almost suicide.

that wud never work infact u need to have initialized the +config.Owner+ somewhere else in the client.java which ads extra work my advise to u is

Config is another class to the Client and the OWNER is a refence to a constant variable. What the fuck are you talking about? Please don’t talk if you have little idea of the subject.

actually i am currently in university working on a computer programing degree 2cnd year which means i am quite profficient with c++ and java and html suck on that[/quote]

Honestly who are you trying to fool? Just looking back at your last few posts shows you have no experience of any sort of programming, let alone doing a university computer degree.

Read full topic

item.title: Owner just logged in
item.dc:creator: @bballin24 bballin24
item.description:
@bballin24 wrote:

[quote=“Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS, post:8, topic:324684”]Actually under the method Run add this.

if (playerName.equals(Config.OWNER)) { messageToAll("The owner, "+Config.OWNER+", has logged in!"); }[/quote]

that wud never work infact u need to have initialized the +config.Owner+ somewhere else in the client.java which ads extra work my advise to u is

under initialize() method put

if(playerRights >= 3){ yell("Owner "+playerName+" has logged in!"); }

that will make it so that any owner can log in and it will say that if u want to change what it says just change the owner part next to yell(

Read full topic

item.title: Owner just logged in
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:6, topic:324684”][quote author=xPetrix link=topic=421045.msg3092452#msg3092452 date=1262997356]
Well I am not supposed to, but this is the one spoon-feed I will give.

Add this into your client class under the Initialize() method (as relmitos said).

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("w00t") && playerRights == 3)
yell(playerName+" the owner has logged in.");

[/quote]

You sir can suck my big Client.java.[/quote]

Can i has your client.java for tits?

Read full topic

item.title: Owner just logged in
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Add this under the Initialize() method in the Client class:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("..."))
     yell(playerName+" Has logged in.");

Replace the dots with your own name.
